intro: Pterichis tunguraguona, commonly known as the Tunguragua palm, is a rare and endemic species native to the Andes Mountains of Ecuador. It is a small, slow-growing palm with a solitary trunk and feather-like leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, followed by clustered, round fruits that are orange-red in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Its botanical characteristics make it an important subject for conservation and botanical research.
